main.commit_message: Bump version to 3.3.2

Improve documentation of pagespecs

Fix an error in the syntax in the error message output by the specs parser,
and make it and the syntax given in pstops(1) the same, modifying both.

Clarify that rotation is around the page’s bottom left corner.

Add short-edge duplex incantation to the man page examples.

Update man page example to work for any paper with the A/B-series ratio

Thanks, @jgclark!

Merge pull request #63 from cclauss/patch-1

ci.yml: Upgrade GitHub Actions
ci.yml: Upgrade GitHub Actions
Bump version to 3.3.1
Add a test using pstops man page duplex example
pstops: fix duplex booklet example in man page (fix #62)
pyproject.toml: bump version to 3.3.0

Update to pypdf 3.16 (fix #57)

Add a regression test.
tox.ini: add more types libraries for testenv, for recent pytest

psnup: improve page size guessing and its documentation

Now that we can read the page size of PostScript documents, we only use the
default size from `paper` *in extremis*. Set input size from guess or output
size first, then set output size from input size if available; lastly, use
`paper`.

Add a missing object copy whose lack was causing the output size to be
incorrectly changed during processing.
tests/test_psnup.py: minor whitespace fix

psnup: use bool for a flag, not float as 1/0

The “rotate” flag to reduce_waste is really a boolean.
GitHub: install libpaper from brew on macOS

Relax pypdf dependency again to >= 3.15.0

Update test results for latest version (3.15.4)

Tests: compare PDFs as images when not byte-identical (fix #61)

When PDFs are not byte identical, convert each page to an image and compare
it (pixel-identical). If this test passes, output a warning.

This way, minor changes to pypdf can be easily seen to be unimportant, and
the dependency can be updated and test results regenerated as desired.
Remove unused test helper function
Bump version to 3.2.0

Improve treatment of DSC comments

Don’t treat the “:” after the keyword as part of the keyword.

Try harder to read the input paper size of PostScript documents

Try the BoundingBox, PageBoundingBox and HiResBoundingBox values, if
available.

If BoundingBox or HiResBoundingBox is used, note that the value is a guess,
and tell the user when it is used to set a required input page size.
Bump version to 3.1.2
Restore --version flag to pstops, accidentally removed in 3.1.0
pyproject.toml: require a precise version of pypdf, as new versions keep breaking the tests
MANIFEST.in: don't mention removed file psjoin-include.man
Bump version to 3.1.1
Require pypdf >= 3.15.2, as some test results changed in that version
Bump version to 3.1.0

Output PDF to BytesIO(), as pyPDF needs to seek

Then write to outfile, in case outfile is stdout.
pstops: add backwards-compatible SPECS argument with no --specs option

Argument parsing: split out file arguments from all options

This is in preparation for adding a backwards-compatible optional SPECS
argument to pstops.
psresize.py: remove unused import
pyproject.toml: bump pypdf dependency to 3.15.0 (missing from 3.0.9)
Bump version to 3.0.9
Upgrade to pypdf 3.15, fix deprecated API call
README.md: note the required version of Python 3
Bump version to 3.0.8

Update to pypdf 3.12

Update test results to match: 3.11 causes PyPDF to remove some unnecessary
parts of output files.
Bump version to 3.0.7
Run paper in C locale (fix #54, thanks @jneug)
Bump version to 3.0.6
URLs: seems we need capitalized “Homepage” after all
Restrict PyPDF to < 3.11.0, to avoid test failures
Bump version to 3.0.5
Fix spelling of “homepage” URL (fixes #52, thanks @AMDmi3!)
tox.ini: remove unused envrironment variable from test env
Makefile: fix and simplify GitHub release creation
Bump version to 3.0.4
Ensure --draw argument has a value in all cases
Makefile: no need to create or push a release tag, as 'gh release create' does that
Bump version to 3.0.3
MANIFEST.in: add missing .enc test files
Bump version to 3.0.2
MANIFEST.in: include conftest.py in the distribution
README.md: add some line breaks
Change PyPI package name to 'pspdfutils' so we can release it
Bump version to 3.0.1
Remove some obsolete test files
Add missing test-files directory to distribution
tests/testutils.py: remove some redundant assertions
Use def instead of lambda to fix a Pylint warning
pstops: note that --draw line width is fixed for PDF
test/conftest.py: make pytest imports consistent
Update license text in version banner to point to GPL online
Move version banners into a single one in psutils.argparse
README.md: update usage example to reflect new module arrangement
README.md: change installation instructions to install from GitHub for now
Makefile: separate out PyPI release target, and add GitHub release
Add some FIXMEs and rename pstops method of DocumentTransform
psnup: fix a FIXME, get paper_context from argparse parser
psresize: allow die from psnup to propagate directly

psselect: do the transformation directly

Rather than calling the pstops command.

This revealed that an invalid page range was giving an incorrect exit code!
Now fixed.

Reorganize library into multiple modules

Move command modules into subdirectory “command”.

Add superclass DocumentTransform and function document_reader

pstops() becomes a method of DocumentTransform.

This allows us to avoid constructing a *Transform or *Reader more than once
in psbook and psnup.

Rename document_transform() to file_transform() and add a new function
document_transform() (not a contextmanager) which returns a
{Pdf,Ps}Transform.
tox.ini: reorder testenv deps more logically

pyproject.toml: add missing man page

Also ensure that both scripts and manpages are listed in alphabetic order.
Shorten declarations of main functions

Simplify parsespecs() to use just a PaperContext to specify paper size

Remove the extra “size” argument.
Simplify parsing of dimensions with re.match

Add PaperContext class to hold default paper size

This avoids parsedimen having to make an expensive call to paper(), and the
earlier C-like mechanism of a global holding the value alongside a flag
indicating whether it’s been initialized.
Make dimension parsing simpler and stricter
Fold parsedimen functions into singledimen functions
singledimen: get rid of global variable optimization
Pylint: enable too-few-public-methods globally
Represent procset location as a range
psutils/__init__.py: fix comment typo
Remove unused global scale and rotation
Pylint: enable useless-suppression
Pylint: re-enable too-many-instance-attributes globally
Represent page sizes with new class Rectangle
psnup: use long options to invoke pstops, for clarity

tests: add tests that set the input size (both correctly & incorrectly)

This needed changes:

* psnup must always supply the input paper size to pstops, even if it’s the
same as the output size, so that when the user wants to override the actual
input paper size, their size is used, not the actual size of the
document (if available).

* For PDF documents, the user-supplied size must always override the actual
page size.
tests: don't fail when we regenerate input or expected stderr

Fix referring to paper size when output paper unset (fix #35)

This revealed some test results that were not exactly right: pstops was
guessing that the input paper size was the same as the output paper
size (which it wasn’t), and was doing things a bit wrong, for example
imposing a portrait input page on the same size landscape output
page (psnup/20-1-flipped-dimensions). The PDF results were also wrong in
this and another similar case!

Also, by parsing the size information, we get slightly different dimensions
in one test (psresize/20-A3in-A4), so the output is slightly different.

Extract PsReader class from PsDocumentTransform

The {Ps,Pdf}Reader is then passed to the transform class’s constructor.

Also rename {Ps,Pdf}DocumentTransform to {Ps,Pdf}Transform, for consistency.

Rename variables holding Transform classes from “doc” to “transform”.

As well as making the code easier to maintain, this change will allow us to
set the page size of the input from the PostScript file: we need to be able
to do this in all callers of the transform classes (in particular, in
programs other than pstops).
tests: add a psnup test that used to be in a comment
Add old scripts back for those who want them

Make terminology more consistent about “page size” vs “paper size”

Prefer “page size”, as the documents we deal with may never be printed!
epsffit: remove a FIXME, we want to keep current behaviour
Fix referring to paper size when output paper unset (fix #35)
tests: patch argv[0] to give correct program name in psutils errors

Generate all combination of epsffit tranforms as tests

Add those that are missing.

Also fix a bug where .eps test results were compared as binary, not text.
Add a couple of module docstrings

Pylint: enable invalid-name and too-many-nested-blocks

Improve some names, add a list of “good-names” for those I like.

“too-many-nested-blocks” was not triggering any more.

Pylint: enable too-few-public-methods and too-many-instance-attributes

Make Range a dataclass so it can have no public methods, and disable
too-many-instance-attributes where needed.

Make PageSpec a dataclass and its offset a NamedTuple Offset

The consequential changes fixed a minor inefficiency where null translations
were output.

Pylint: enable too-many-boolean-expressions

Disable it in one place.
Common up code for common ArgumentParser flags

Tests: rename ‘datadir’ parameter to ‘fixture_dir’

Avoid confusion with similarly-named ‘datafiles’ fixture.
Ignore CreationDate in PostScript comparisons

Rename pushd contextmanager to chdir and make it a polyfill

Python 3.11 adds contextlib.chdir.
setup.py: add to linting, and fix errors

Add input regeneration, simplify test code further

Generate input file name from specification of generated input.

Have strictly one test per directory.

Regenerate test files, with trivial differences in the PostScript.

Simplify test specification, add result regeneration

Add expected stderr output for all tests.

Add --regenerate-expected flag to copy output to expected files.

Simplify the specification of tests with new make_tests function.

Restructure expected files directories.
Makefile: add test target, for new release target
CI: no need to install argparse-manpage
Use argparse-manpage 4.2
Makefile: rewrite release target for PyPI
Pylint: enable duplicate-code, which no longer triggers
Reformat with black, fixing too-long lines

Pylint: enable ‘unspecified-encoding’

Use ASCII in tests, as we shouldn’t get anything else in our PostScript
inputs.
psjoin: use binary I/O to avoid potential encoding problems
testutils: improve names of some functions
Restore -w, -h, -W and -H flags for backwards compatibility
Pylint: lint the tests
Makefile: count test code in 'loc' target
Refactor most uses of streams with context managers
Fix some unused/badly expressed imports in tests

Slurp input

This simplifies the code because we don’t need to possibly copy stdin to a
temporary file; instead, present input as a (seekable) BytesIO.

Also, we no longer need chainstream.

This removes the “make_seekable” argument from setup_input_and_output,
paving the way for us to encapsulate it in DocumentTransform.
psutils: make inadvertent class attributes into instance attributes
Pylint: shorten auto-generated comments in pyproject.toml
Pylint: remove use of 'global' statement
Pylint: don't redefine outer names
Pylint: allow import warnings and move imports to top of all files
Pylint: remove some code style suppressions and fix their warnings
Move pylint configuration to pyproject.toml
Update documentation for Python build and to mention PDF support

Use unreleased argparse-manpage to move to pyproject.toml

Remove setup.cfg.
Use unreleased argparse-manpage to include hand-written man page
Rename entry points from 'main' to name of each module

Remove old test runner and translate mktestfile to Python (fix #47)

mktestfile now produces slightly different, but cleaner output (no
superfluous newline at the end of the text used to generate the PostScript),
so when test files are regenerated, false failures will occur and the
expected outputs will have to be updated.
Make new tests clearer and shorter
CI: don't install test deps, as tox will do that anyway
Convert tests to Python
extractres: fix use-before-init
psjoin: don't reopen stdout, just write to underlying buffer
Use importlib.metadata instead of deprecated pkg_resources

Use “Union[]” not “|” type notation for Python < 3.10

Also remove unused Any type import.
Flush output streams in finalize() method
GitHub Actions: build libpaper in home directory, not subdirectory
tests: fix a FIXME: PDF tests do not need input paper size
setup.cfg: add FIXME to distribute psutils.1
mypy: check all files with exclusions, not just psutils module

mypy: merge config into pyproject.toml

Also run linting and mypy before tests, for fast failure.
Makefile: fix incorrect dependency
Makefile: update 'loc' target now all sources are in psutils package

Merge pdf* scripts into ps* scripts

Convert all I/O to binary. This is necessary so we can test the MIME type of
the input before knowing whether it’s text or binary. It doesn’t hurt to
handle PostScript as binary, in any case.

Add MIME type detection with “puremagic” to work out whether we’re dealing
with PostScript or PDF in each case.
Move page writing into class methods to make pstops and pdftopdf the same

Move pagespecs into document classes

Move PageSpec into psutils module.

Make use_procset an attribute of PsDocumentTransform (and add “Transform”
suffix to the document classes).
Refactor computation of page label to be the same in pstops and pdftopdf
tox.ini: remove unused testenv dependency

Move fcopy and comment functions into PsDocument class

Also simplify and rename comment to comment_keyword.

Import PsDocument and PdfDocument as Document, to reduce diff between pstops
and pdftopdf further.

We now just have the body of each program’s transform() function to merge.
Move input and output paper size into document classes
tox.ini: add missing types needed for pypdf by recent mypy
setup.py: remove unused 'type: ignore' comment

Remove --bind option

Ignore it for backwards compatibility.

Subsume differences between pstops and pdftopdf into classes

Add PsDocument and PdfDocument classes, subclasses of (currently empty)
Document.
mypy.ini: remove obsolete commented-out line
pstops: move fcopy into psutils module
psutils: fix a potentially uninitialized variable
setup.py: ignore a type warning

pstops/pdftopdf: reduce the diff between the two

Move the PSUtils procset into the psutils module.
pstops: fix a test (copied from pdftopdf)

pstops: localize calculate of pages per spec

This makes the code more similar to pdftopdf
Actually generate man pages with new argparse-manpage
Use pypdf 3.8.0 and remove our patch

Convert code to entry points, use new argparse-manpage

For now, use a fork of argparse-manpage with a bug fix.

Remove the git submodule of argparse-manpage.

Having all the code in one package simplifies calling pylint and mypy (only
need to call them once each).
tox.ini: does not need run-time dependencies
setup.py: swallow output of 'paper' when testing it
MANIFEST.in: add the rest of the manpages
setup.cfg: 'requires' key should be 'install_requires'
Fold pdfutils library back into psutils library
setup.cfg: bump version to 3.0
ps/pdfselect: restore backwards compatible page range argument syntax

Add support for PDF files

This adds a parallel set of “pdfutils”, and a parallel set of tests.

Also add a test for “ps/pdfnup --draw”, and fix a bug in psnup where the
“--draw” and “--quiet” arguments were not passed on to pstops.

There is no mention of them in the documentation as yet, but I intend to
merge the PDF support so that one set of scripts can cope with both file
types.
psnup: fix missing implementation of pass-through flags
extractres: fix a FIXME, rename a variable
tests/pstops-correct-angles/test.sh: fix input paper size
pre-inst-env: utility for running scripts in-place
pstops: delete parsing of page label that is not used
pstops: move a global variable into a function
Convert README to markdown (fix #45)
Make imports from psutils modules precise

Make mypy happy with all the code

Changes include fixing a bug in extractres, and adding some record-like
classes instead of just using dicts with string keys.

Run pylint on the programs

Fixes include some minor bug fixes: regexs that were not r-strings, and an
accidentally-shadowed global.
Fix --version printing in all programs
Add more tests from TeXLive

pstops: simplify page number printing code

This results in a small change to the PostScript page comments: when a blank
page is inserted, its label will be “(*)” rather than “*”.
pstops: improve the name of a variable

Add two tests from TeXLive

As a result, add and use the ability to check the stderr output from a test.

pstops: fix output of real page numbers

Since the first Perl version, pstops was only outputting sequential page
numbers rather than the real page numbers/page specs from the input.
pstops: fix some incorrect indentation
tests/run-test: collect stderr from test so we can compare it
tox.ini: allow individual tests to be run
Convert build system from GNU autotools to Python setuptools
Remove old-scripts directory
Translate PSUtils into Python
Improve psbook documentation (fix #43)
extractres: remove an unused variable
configure.ac: bump version to 2.10
Bump some copyright dates
psjoin: remove some redundant code

pstops: don't use procset when we have an x and y offset of 0

We could have a defined but zero offset, and that would cause the
unnecessary use of the procset.
pstops: simplify the code to check whether procset is needed
pstops.in.in: fix an inconsistency in the help

Minor fixes to input handling

Set binary mode on input after making it seekable, not before. This is more
likely to succeed!

Simplify seekable() slightly: we don’t have to reopen the original file
handle from the new one.

PSUtils.pm: fix paper() when called with empty command options list

Pass --no-size to paper so we just get the name back.

Also move the comment line above paper() to above paper_size, where it
belongs.
PSUtils.pm: ensure strtod is always run in C locale
PSUtils.pm: remove some redundant quotes
PSUtils.pm: remove redundant call to chomp()
Add GitHub Actions CI
Remove AppVeyor CI
AppVeyor: update URL and name of libpaper
PSUtils.pm: use a less confusing test
README: remove email addresses and a duplicate entry from acknowledgements

Remove Debian packaging

This is now maintained at https://salsa.debian.org/debian/libpaper/

AppVeyor: add m4 version requirement for macOS

Also add other program versions required (stanza was missing from
bootstrap.conf).
Require libpaper, and add test to configure.ac
configure.ac: bump version to 2.0.9
Add short option -v for --version for backwards compatibility to all programs
configure.ac: bump version to 2.08

man pages: names of programs should always start with lower-case letter

Even at the start of a sentence. Thanks, @hmartink!

PSUtils.pm: update invocation of paper, and improve parsing of output

paper doesn’t take a --size argument any longer, so remove it.

Paper’s output is now “XXXxYYY pt”, so parse it correctly.

v2-perl.commit_message: Improve psbook documentation (fix #43)
extractres: remove an unused variable
configure.ac: bump version to 2.10
Bump some copyright dates
psjoin: remove some redundant code

pstops: don't use procset when we have an x and y offset of 0

We could have a defined but zero offset, and that would cause the
unnecessary use of the procset.
pstops: simplify the code to check whether procset is needed
pstops.in.in: fix an inconsistency in the help

Minor fixes to input handling

Set binary mode on input after making it seekable, not before. This is more
likely to succeed!

Simplify seekable() slightly: we don’t have to reopen the original file
handle from the new one.

PSUtils.pm: fix paper() when called with empty command options list

Pass --no-size to paper so we just get the name back.

Also move the comment line above paper() to above paper_size, where it
belongs.
PSUtils.pm: ensure strtod is always run in C locale
PSUtils.pm: remove some redundant quotes
PSUtils.pm: remove redundant call to chomp()
Add GitHub Actions CI
Remove AppVeyor CI
AppVeyor: update URL and name of libpaper
PSUtils.pm: use a less confusing test
README: remove email addresses and a duplicate entry from acknowledgements

Remove Debian packaging

This is now maintained at https://salsa.debian.org/debian/libpaper/

AppVeyor: add m4 version requirement for macOS

Also add other program versions required (stanza was missing from
bootstrap.conf).
Require libpaper, and add test to configure.ac
configure.ac: bump version to 2.0.9
Add short option -v for --version for backwards compatibility to all programs
configure.ac: bump version to 2.08

man pages: names of programs should always start with lower-case letter

Even at the start of a sentence. Thanks, @hmartink!

PSUtils.pm: update invocation of paper, and improve parsing of output

paper doesn’t take a --size argument any longer, so remove it.

Paper’s output is now “XXXxYYY pt”, so parse it correctly.
